hero.headline: Get Your Own Prompt Library
hero.description: This entire project is open-source and available for you to download, modify, and use for your own prompt library. Perfect for individuals, teams, or businesses who want complete control over their AI prompt collection.

header.title: What You Get
header.description: Everything you need to build and manage your own AI prompt library, completely free and customizable.

items.title: Complete Source Code
items.description: Full access to all code, including the AI integration, user interface, and prompt management system. Built with modern technologies like Astro, TypeScript, and Tailwind CSS.

items.title: AI Integration Ready
items.description: Pre-configured integration with Google Gemini AI through the Vercel AI SDK. Easy to swap for other AI providers or add multiple AI models.

items.title: Modern Tech Stack
items.description: Built with Astro for fast static sites, TypeScript for type safety, Tailwind CSS for styling, and comprehensive testing with Vitest.

items.title: Responsive Design
items.description: Mobile-first design that works perfectly on all devices. Dark mode support and accessibility features built-in from the start.

items.title: Easy Deployment
items.description: Deploy anywhere - Netlify, Vercel, GitHub Pages, or your own server. Static site generation means fast loading and low hosting costs.

items.title: Fully Customizable
items.description: Modify the design, add new features, integrate with your existing systems. The code is clean, well-documented, and easy to understand.

cta.headline: Understanding Open Source
cta.description: Open source software is code that anyone can view, use, and modify. Think of it like a recipe that's shared freely - you can use it exactly as written, or change ingredients to suit your taste. This project is open source, which means you get complete freedom and control.

header.title: Frequently Asked Questions
header.description: Everything you need to know about using this open-source project for your own prompt library.

items.question: Do I need to be a developer to use this?
items.answer: While some technical knowledge helps, the project includes detailed setup instructions. If you can follow a recipe, you can likely get this running. For major customizations, you might want to work with a developer.

items.question: What AI services does it work with?
items.answer: Currently configured for Google Gemini, but the Vercel AI SDK supports OpenAI, Anthropic, Cohere, and many others. Switching providers typically requires changing just a few lines of code.

items.question: How much does it cost to run?
items.answer: The hosting can be free (Netlify, Vercel, GitHub Pages). You'll only pay for AI API calls based on your usage. Google Gemini has generous free tiers to get you started.

items.question: Can I remove the branding and make it my own?
items.answer: Absolutely! You can customize everything - colors, logos, text, layout. Make it completely your own brand. The open-source license gives you full freedom to modify and rebrand.

items.question: What's the difference between open source and free software?
items.answer: Open source means you can see and modify the code. 'Free' usually means no cost, but you might not get the code. This project is both - free to use AND you get all the source code to modify as needed.

items.question: Can I use this for my business?
items.answer: Yes! You can use this for personal projects, client work, or your own business. The only restriction is that you can't resell the original code itself - but you can absolutely build commercial services with it.

items.question: Is there ongoing support?
items.answer: This is a community project. While we can't provide individual support, you can report bugs and request features on GitHub where the community can help.

items.question: Can I contribute improvements back?
items.answer: Yes! Open source thrives on community contributions. If you add features or fix bugs, you're welcome to submit them back to help others.

header.title: Need Help Getting Started?
header.description: Have questions about setting up your own prompt library? Check out the documentation or connect with the community.

content.subtitle: Resources & Community
content.description: Getting started with open source can feel overwhelming, but you're not alone. We've prepared comprehensive documentation and there's a helpful community ready to assist.
